intro: Impatiens mullaingiriensis, commonly known as the Mullaingiri impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing in forest understories or near streams. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
